comment: Actually a really good class. Prof really does suck at his jokes, but in the teaching stuff he cares.
Class was actually good. Amoroso is pretty funny actually. He shook hands with everyone in the group after their presentation. Nothing negative.
prof gives lots of extra credit
IF YOU ACTUALLY WANT TO LEARN SOMETHING, TAKE THIS COURSE WITH A DIFFERENT INSTRUCTOR! NO CLASS FOR 1 MONTH!! WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!!!
This is a good class overall. Professor is out periodically so have to keep up with the project.
Well prof was really direct with presentation group. Twice. And made them stop. Better practice before you get into this class.
Hybrid course so have to keep up with postings.  Also have to work regularly on project.
Actually quite easy course, but have to do the posts right or you don't get full credit. project was group, so that was easy.
Group project was intense. Course was good. Prof went over the book in detail each week.
Turned out to be a good class.

Worst professor I've ever taken, bar none.  Unorganized.  Constantly changes due dates.  Unclear on all assignments.  Talks about Apple all class instead of lecturing but still tests you on the material.  His constant immature self-indulgence makes him unfit to actually perform the necessary job of, you know, giving you an education.

He is really indecisive but really easy to attain an A in. I took it over the summer and I know for a fact I failed the final and I still got an A. He's really nice if you get on his good side from the beginning. Trust me!! I missed a few days of class because my dad got a heart attack and he was so nice about  turning in assignments.

This course is online only. At first, the workload was ridiculous, like two courses. Then he adjusted the workload after the second week. There is a group project and cases. Have to keep up with the work because it is assigned every two weeks. Online posts are time consuming.

Take global from a professor like this who has been global. Otherwise it is a serious waste of time. Amoroso explains details of culture and stories. Have to ask questions about the group project so dont get lost.

Best class and one of the best professors. The workload can be a little high, but overall it was quite manageable. The summer class however can seem like extra workload. Professor is very helpful, just have to ask a lot of questions.

Amoroso is dense. If your opinion doesn't match his, you're wrong. Self-indulgent/huge ego. Demanding. Indecisive. Vague with what he expects on your assignments. And if you want to know what grade you have before you take the final, forget it. You will have no idea how to gauge what grade you will end up with. Good luck.
I was attended his lecture series here in the Philippines i was amazed to him the way he taught his students wished he will have again a lecture series for Information Systems Students
Unable to state course objectives in a timely manner. It was like pulling teeth to even get a syllabus. Very sarcastic teaching style.
This class was horrible. DO not take this professor. Way too much work. Unclear syllabus.
Best professor, helps us with our project throughout the semester. Brings in CIOs to talk to the class. Has tons of connections. Overall excellent class.

Actually I took this class in Spring semester and it was good because even had real company directors and actual CIO on the screen or guest lecture. Lots of people hated the Friday all day class but I liked it.

Online class is quite good. Really not a hard class at all. Textbook is expensive though and wold be nice if we could download e-version. You should work 3 times harder in first month to get the case formatting otherwise you will get two low grades on the first two cases. Good news is that they are not worth that much.
Taking online course now it is well designed. Professor is willing to meet outside of class.
Amoroso is quite good. Enjoyed the class a lot. Took it in the summer where it was hybrid. You have to nail the cases hard early in the semester in order to get the A.
Would help u over and over. Keep bothering him.
Very demanding in the summer. Hybrid format helped a lot. You knew what to expect so no surprises.
Taking this class in a 4-week semester while working full-time is nearly insane. However, I really enjoyed the class and learned a lot.  Easily one of the best classes in the MSIS program.
Loved this class. Hybrid class is wonderful. Professor is great.
Have to like cases to like this class. Worked hard, but learned how to think STRATEGY a lot.

Great class, best class. Dr. Amoroso is VERY busy, no way to drop in and talk. Plus he is in the Center so not so convenient. Better make an appointment. Suggest talking over earlier cases that are worth less points to get a hold on how it works, then to slam the later cases.
Good news it's over!  Short class but hard hitting. 4 week classes are hard to take, lots of cases to write.
Professor knew his stuff so you couldnt fake it. Have to talk in class, so if shy might have a problem. It was all case studies.
Taking it now as hybrid. Good class.
Taking in the summer. Going fast but not hard. Should take it in the summer. All cases in this course. You should like to write cases report format.

I took this professor last semester. Actually its not that hard of a class. Once you get the case format done, which took a lot of time, then it was easy to drop in all of the remaining case assignments. The final exam was exactly what he said it would be. No surprises.
Class was not that hard. Professor is fun. Cases were challenging, mostly because of format. Speakers were great.

This class was excellent. Only six cases, so apparently much improved over last semester. Professor taught class hybrid on Fridays and that made it much better. Exam was as expected. Brought in guest speakers making it more interesting. Learned strategy and use it at my work every day. Overall excellent experience. Best class in MSIS program.

Just finished the course in Spring 2011 and it was really very informative. The guest speakers from Atlanta and Tokyo were excellent. This course focuses on strategy and culture, so we discussed many leadership positions, especially Japan. The six cases will take a lot of work though. Exam is take home essay paper. Best class-cases and discussions.
I took this professor in Spring 2010, he did 4 cases and research paper. Worked in groups, was reasonable, one of the best professors I took in the MSIS program.
OK whatever I took this in Fall. It's a hard class because of all of the cases, but the best class in the program. Everything was very clear and organized with Vista.

He is by far the most difficult and worst professor I have ever had in my life.  Avoid him like the plague because he has roughly 30-40 hours of homework per week if you want to get an A (literally; just read the rest of the reviews and you will understand).  He is not helpful at all and comes across as just plain mean.  This professor is sadistic.

I hate this class!!! Professor gives an unreasonable amount of work. He thinks he is the boss and everyone has to listen to him. If you do not attend one of his lectures you are 1 grade down, does that sound ridicules.Huh I want to finish this as soon as I can.

Gives way too much pointless load for a 3 credit hour course. Does not teach or spend time teaching. Makes his rules as the course goes by. Willfully accuses and threatens students of things they haven't done. Avoid this class if you can. Its a useless nightmare.

course definitely geared towards students who are not working or working part-time only. This professor thinks that everyone is trying to cheat him, and that you don't have anything else going on in your life.

There's a line between giving students enough work to learn and way too much work. His philosophy is that you will hate me now but you'll love me later! Class is very painful, he makes up rules as he goes, no clear instructions, lectures are crammed up into 5 fridays (8-5), which if you are a working professional will have to take vacation days.
Wrongly accuses people of plagiarism and things they haven't done or even thought about doing.
